title: Reduce number of `git config` runs?
body:
In light of #1383 decided to whine about may be considering to make git config calls less frequent?  now that we are using flyweight pattern for all the datasets/*Repos, we have centralized `.config` access and could track when/if any change was made thus requiring or not reload of configuration upon next read.
Here is eg. a sample to get a taste of abundance of those calls:
```shell
(git)hopa:~datalad/datalad[opt-tests]git
$> DATALAD_LOG_TIMESTAMP=1 DATALAD_LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG python -m nose -s -v datalad/interface/tests/test_utils.py:test_save_hierarchy 2>&1 | tools/dtime | sort -n | grep git.*config | nl
...
     7	    5 2017-03-20 10:05:03,773 [DEBUG] Running: ['git', 'config', '-z', '-l']
     8	    5 2017-03-20 10:05:03,928 [DEBUG] Running: ['git', 'config', '--local', 'annex.backends', 'MD5E']
     9	    5 2017-03-20 10:05:03,974 [DEBUG] Running: ['git', 'config', '-z', '-l']
...
   294	  116 2017-03-20 10:05:20,278 [DEBUG] Running: ['git', 'config', '-z', '-l']
   295	  125 2017-03-20 10:05:22,925 [DEBUG] Running: ['git', 'config', '-z', '-l']
   296	  164 2017-03-20 10:05:19,365 [DEBUG] Running: ['git', 'config', '-z', '-l']
   297	  165 2017-03-20 10:05:17,883 [DEBUG] Running: ['git', 'config', '-z', '-l']
   298	  257 2017-03-20 10:05:03,427 [DEBUG] Running: ['git', 'config', '-z', '-l']
DATALAD_LOG_TIMESTAMP=1 DATALAD_LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG python -m nose -s -v  2>&1  7.04s user 4.01s system 55% cpu 20.085 total
```
so not necessarily that (2nd column) is the timing for running those commands (forgot how to enable that timing protocolling... did we ever finish it? ;-)), but it gives an idea at least on a number of those calls -- almost 300 in the duration of that test.  Even with 5 msec for each, that is 1.5sec of the total run time of the test.
